sn2.3:1.2: Then, when the night had advanced, the young deva Māgha, of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Jeta’s Grove, approached the Blessed One.
sn2.3:1.3: Having approached, he paid homage to the Blessed One, stood to one side, > and addressed the Blessed One in verse:
sn2.3:2.1: 146  257 “Having slain what does one sleep soundly?
sn2.3:2.2: Having slain what does one not sorrow?
sn2.3:2.4: O Gotama, Whose killing you approve?”
sn2.3:3.2: Having slain anger, one does not sorrow;
sn2.3:3.4: With its poisoned root and honeyed tip, O Vatrabhū,
sn2.3:3.5: This is the killing the noble ones praise,
sn2.3:3.6: For having slain that, one does not sorrow. ”
